CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 7, 1955, pg. 19, reads: "The Man Jumps - Walt Harper, the man who keeps Pittsburgh dance fans happy with his real gone music, has taken on added chores these days. Besides fronting his dance group Walt has become a dee-jay over Station WHOD in Homestead, Pa. He's tops in both jobs.  The lovely chick shown with Harper in above picture is his vocalist Tiny Irwin [Irvin].  She formerly chirped with Dizzy Gillespie. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Tiny Irvin playing maracas, and Walt Harper playing cowbell, in front of band with Nate Harper with tenor saxophone, Marion "Boonie" Hazel with trumpet, and trombonist Jon Morris on claves, on stage in Fort Pitt Hotel
